long: Meaning: to "spread out" (i.e. deploy in hostile array); by analogy, to "strip" (i.e. unclothe, plunder, flay, etc.).  Usage: fall upon, flay, invade, make an invasion, pull off, put off, make a road, run upon, rush, set, spoil, spread selves (abroad), strip (off, self).  Source: a primitive root;
